ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:
Which of the following best describes your mode of learning in this course?
options: virtual seminar or other discussion format
in-person seminar or other discussion format

narratives.question_text:
What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: In this class, I learned how to read and parse through astrophysics papers, and gained a pretty broad understanding of the current state of astrophysics and cosmology.

narratives.question_text:
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments:
Pieter is an extremely smart, well versed astrophysicist. He is obviously very knowledgable about the forefront of the current state of astrophysics research, mainly because half of the material talked about his own papers. It was a course that gave me a broad understanding of various subfields in astrophysics, and because a lot of the research is so recent, a lot of questions naturally popped out from the material. The material of the course was interesting, relevant, and engaging. 

However, I think that often the course notes were hard to read, and a lot of the class had to be fueled by my own personal research through astrophysics papers. The timeline of problem sets was unevenly distributed, with three of the four psets assigned and due in the last month of the course. And because this course is also an intro grad school course, the undergraduate grading scheme is not strictly defined, making it hard to determine how well I was doing in class.
It was a super relaxed and interesting class.

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I think that the virtual format of the course made it hard to sometimes participate and engage with lecture, though having the lectures and office hours recorded was extremely helpful when reviewing material. I wish that there were more opportunities to have office hours, as I had a class during the office hours sessions, and could never make the section.

narratives.question_text:
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I would recommend the course to students interested in pursuing astrophysics research. This class is taught by an amazing, well known astrophysics professor, but there was sparse feedback for the problem sets as well as how I was doing (as an undergraduate) in the course. It is a tough class, but worth it for interested astrophysics students.
If youre looking for a cool graduate class then yes

narratives.question_text: Please list any other mode(s) of learning, including any combination or variation of the above options.
comments: This class had a live virtual lecture on Tuesdays and Thursdays, followed by an office hours session on Friday. Unfortunately, this time conflicted with one of my courses, and so I never had the opportunity to regularly visit office hours.
